Containers.Description:
DOODS is a GRPC/REST service that detects objects in images using TensorFlow. It's designed to be very easy to use, run as a container and available remotely. Compatible with Coral Edge TPU usb accelerator using tflite.[br][br]
Steps to rus the docker: 1. Create the app folder [b]/appdata/doods[/b] and copy the [a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/snowzach/doods/master/fetch_models.sh"] fetch_models.sh[/a] there. [br][br] 2. Use the unraid console to run it to create a models directory and download several models and outputs and an [b]example.yaml[/b] config file.[br][br] 3. Copy the example and with name config.yaml and edit according to your need. [br][br] 4. Plug the Coral USB if you are going to use it.[br][br] 5. Run de docker.
[span style='color: red;'][b]Note:[/b][/span] If you want to run it in docker using the Coral EdgeTPU, you need to pass the device [b]/dev/bus/usb[/b] to the container. See the documentation for more details.[br][br]
[span style='color: red;'][b]Note:[/b][/span] The log level is setup to [b]INFO[/b] by default, you can change it to [b]DEBUG[/b] to at first time to debug the models output working. See the documentation for more details.[br][br]
[span style='color: red;'][b]Detector Types Supported[/b][/span] [br][br] tflite - Tensorflow lite models - Supports Coral EdgeTPU if hwAccel: true and appropriate model is used [br][br] tensorflow - Tensorflow [br][br] EdgeTPU models can be downloaded from here: [a href="https://coral.ai/models/"] https://coral.ai/models/[/a] (Use the Object Detection Models) [br][br]
